questions.question: 下記の文書を英訳してください。
questions.hint: 未来の予定を表す表現と、「荷造りをする」の動詞句に注目しましょう。
questions.explanation: 「～する予定である」という未来の予定や意思を表す場合、"be going to"を用いるのが自然です。また、「荷造りをする」は"pack one's things"や"pack one's bags"と表現します。選択肢1が最も適切です。
questions.choice1: He is going to move next week, so I am going to help him pack his things.
questions.choice2: He will move next week, so I will help him pack his things.
questions.choice3: He moves next week, so I help him pack his things.
questions.choice4: He is moving next week, so I will help him pack his things.
questions.text: 彼は来週引っ越す予定なので、荷造りを手伝ってあげるつもりです。

questions.question: 下記の文書を英訳してください。
questions.hint: 「～するのに時間がかかる」という構文と、本の感想を述べる表現を考えましょう。
questions.explanation: 「～するのに時間がかかる」は"It takes/took (人) 時間 to do ～"の構文を使うのが一般的です。選択肢2がこの構文を正しく用いています。
questions.choice1: This book took a long time to finish reading, but it was very interesting.
questions.choice2: It took me a long time to read this book, but it was very interesting.
questions.choice3: I spent a long time finishing this book, but it was very interesting.
questions.choice4: To finish reading this book took a long time, but it was very interesting.
questions.scope: 「所要時間と感想」の問題です。
questions.text: この本は読み終えるまでに時間がかかりましたが、とても面白かったです。

questions.question: 下記の文書を英訳してください。
questions.hint: 「～にもかかわらず」を表す接続詞や前置詞の使い分けに注意しましょう。
questions.explanation: 「～にもかかわらず」を表す接続詞は"although"や"even though"、"though"が適切です。"despite"は前置詞なので、"despite the rain"や"despite the fact that it was raining"のように名詞句や"the fact that S+V"が後に続きます。選択肢1の"Although it was raining"が文法的に正しく、意味も合致しています。
questions.choice1: Although it was raining, we went on a picnic.
questions.choice2: Despite it was raining, we went on a picnic.
questions.choice3: Even if it was raining, we went on a picnic.
questions.choice4: While it was raining, we went on a picnic.
questions.text: 雨が降っていたにもかかわらず、私たちはピクニックに出かけました。
